English Definition: an enclosed space, surrounded by seating for spectators, in which a sport, performance, or show takes place
a roped enclosure for boxing or wrestling
(the ring) the profession, sport, or institution of boxing
an official who watches a game or match closely to ensure that the rules are adhered to and (in some sports) to arbitrate on matters arising from the play
British a person willing to testify in writing about the character or ability of someone, especially an applicant for a job
act as the referee of
Chess a position in which a player's king is directly attacked by an opponent's piece or pawn and has no possible move to escape the check. The attacking player thus wins the game
Chess put into checkmate
high renown or honour won by notable achievements
relating to or affecting the muscles
having well-developed muscles
vigorously robust
strike with the fist
occur in turn repeatedly
the action or practice of inflicting severe pain or suffering on someone as a punishment or in order to force them to do or say something
great physical or mental suffering or anxiety
[no object] (of a volcano) become active and eject lava, ash, and gases
break out suddenly and dramatically
giving rise or likely to give rise to controversy or public disagreement
a figure or token used to make moves in a board game
